intro: Neraudia cookii, commonly known as the Cook Islands neraudia, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in small inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, Neraudia cookii is considered a rare and endemic species.
